title: Council Regulation (EEC) No 1223/89 of 3 May 1989 amending Regulation (EEC) No 1008/86 laying down detailed rules for production refunds applicable to potato starch
header:
COUNCIL REGULATION (EEC) No 1223/89 of 3 May 1989 amending Regulation (EEC) No 1008/86 laying down detailed rules for production refunds applicable to potato starch
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
Article 2 of Regulation (EEC) No 1008/86 is hereby replaced by the following:
Â´Article 2
For the 1989/90 marketing year, Member States shall pay producers of potato starch a premium of ECU 18,70 per tonne of potato starch produced.
The premium shall be granted on condition that the potato-starch manufacturer has paid the potato producer the minimum price laid down in Article 1.'

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
It shall apply from 1 July 1989.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 3 May 1989.
For the Council
The President
P. SOLBES
(1) OJ No L 281, 1. 11. 1975, p. 1.
(2) See page 1 of this Official Journal.
(3) OJ No L 94, 9. 4. 1986, p. 5.
